channel.title: Can som1 quickly help me with this?
channel.description:
ive just made a powerchopper and it works fairly good except... it always seems to try and cut the tree's when they are already been cut down:P
this is the part of the script i need a small bit of help with
[scar]If (IsTextAt2(x,y, 'Chop down', 5) = True) then[/scar]
ive tried 'hop' and 'down' and 'hop down'
but its still not working fully
thanks to all people that help :D

item.title: Can som1 quickly help me with this?
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

[quote=“Nashi, post:7, topic:26232”]If IsUpText(‘Chop down’) Then Begin
Mouse(x, y, 0, 0, True);
End;[/quote]
That will chop down every tree. I rather use IsUpTextMulti, because of its better finding and you can cut a specified tree.
i.e.
IsUpTextMulti(‘hop’,‘own’,‘ree’)
IsUpTextMulti(‘hop’,‘own’,‘ak’)
IsUpTextMulti(‘hop’,‘own’,‘illow’)
IsUpTextMulti(‘hop’,‘own’,‘ew’)

Read full topic
item.source: Can som1 quickly help me with this?

item.title: Can som1 quickly help me with this?
item.dc:creator: @Codester93 Codester93
item.description:
@Codester93 wrote:

um, i dont know why, but just use my power woodcutter

[scar]program CodysRunescapewc;
{.include Osi.txt}
{.include par.txt}
const
tree1 = 4616827; //1st color of the tree//
tree2 = 4616827; //2nd color of the same tree//
log1 = 2051671; //1st color of the trees log//
log2 = 2051671; //2nd color of the same trees log//

procedure cutwooddown;
var
x2,y2: integer;
begin
WAIT(5200+RANDOM(346))
if(findcolorspiral2(x2,y2,tree1,1,1,511,413))or
(findcolorspiral2(x2,y2,tree2,1,1,511,413))then
mouse(x2,y2,3,3, true);

end;

procedure dropemdown;
begin
if(invincount=20)then
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log2)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)
dropcolor(log1)

end;

begin repeat
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
cutwooddown;
dropemdown;
until(false)
end.[/scar]

Read full topic
